feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Possible Friday Into Saturday... Elevated surf is expected to develop Friday and continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 15 to 25 mph are expected Friday into Saturday causing large waves to wash up onto the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Wednesday Through Thursday... Elevated surf is expected to develop Wednesday and continue into Thursday. Westerly winds of 25 to 35 mph are expected Wednesday into Thursday causing large waves to wash up onto the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Wednesday Night Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected to develop Wednesday night and continue into Friday. Westerly winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected Wednesday night into Thursday night causing large waves to wash up onto the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 02 at 3:09PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory is now in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 9 to 12 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebrea, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued August 02 at 9:44PM PDT until August 03 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WARM DRY AND BREEZY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .Breezy winds and low humidity levels will be in place for the Wednesday afternoon and early evening. Temperatures will not be as hot, but still reaching the 90s each afternoon. Gusty winds will expand back northward on Wednesday into our northern districts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colville Reservation; Foothills of Northeast Washington; Okanogan Valley

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 02 at 9:44PM PDT until August 03 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WARM DRY AND BREEZY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .Breezy winds and low humidity levels will be in place for the Wednesday afternoon and early evening. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 02 at 9:20PM PDT until August 03 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .Winds will be breezy across the Kittitas Valley, the eastern Columbia River Gorge, and the Lower Columbia Basin through Wednesday. Winds in combination with low humidity will cause rapid fire spread in dry grassy areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT WEDNESDAY
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin
